meanings.definition: The action of making someone or something unable to function properly.
meanings.sent1: The disablement of the computer system caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent2: His injury resulted in a temporary disablement of his arm.
meanings.sent3: The disablement of the alarm clock led to him oversleeping.
meanings.sent4: The disablement of the main engine left the ship stranded at sea.
meanings.sent5: The disablement of the security system allowed the thieves to enter undetected.

meanings.definition: The state of being unable to function properly.
meanings.sent1: She struggled with the disablement of her phone's touch screen.
meanings.sent2: The disablement of the elevator caused inconvenience for the residents.
meanings.sent3: The disablement of the TV remote made changing channels a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The disablement of the traffic lights led to a chaotic intersection.
meanings.sent5: The disablement of his memory made it difficult for him to recall important details.
